DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the recovery rates of moderately malnourished Malawian children treated with either milk-enriched corn/soy blend, soy/peanut fortified spread or a commercially produced ready-to-use therapy food.
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Comparison of Three Supplementary Foods in the Treatment of Moderate Acute Malnutrition
DOC.criteria: WHZ <2 but >3 without bilateral pedal edema Reside within 7 kilometers of study site. Not permanent resident in vicinity of study site. Severe chronic illness such as cerebral palsy. History of peanut allergy or anaphylaxis resulting from any food. Receiving other supplementary food or participating in other research.
